item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: 7 Best Tranq Bombs Farming Spots
item.description:
Monster Hunter Wilds' 2025 launch brought along millions of hunters ready to take on the latest monsters Capcom's developers have cooked up. Capcom hasn't been resting on its laurels, with additional content making its way via Title Update 1. With the return of classic monsters, new gear, and a limited-time spring event, those with busy lives will understandably want to acquire the exclusive event gear in the most efficient manner possible.

Capturing a monster will result in less time spent hunting, meaning hunters will need a supply of Tranq Bombs on hand at all times. While Tranq Bombs can be bought, the most efficient way to acquire them is to craft them, which requires both Sleep Herbs and Parashrooms.

Trading With Apar For Sleep Herbs

Earn Sleep Herbs Between Hunts

  • Sleep Herbs are one of the two essential ingredients to craft Tranq Bombs.
  • In addition to Tranq Bombs, Sleep Herbs can also be used to craft Sleep Ammo and Sleep Coating for ranged weapons.

While the option to scour each map at one's own pace is available, most hunters will want to spend their time hunting. Thankfully, asking Nata to request items from other villages will allow hunters to passively earn requested materials, desire sensor permitting. Sleep herbs can be obtained if the player asks Apar from the village of Suja.

Given that Sleep Herbs are listed as a 3-star item when trading with Apar, players are likely to receive a fairly consistent stream of them between hunts.

Trading With Rysher For Parashrooms

Passively Obtain Parashrooms

  • Parashrooms are one of two essential ingredients for crafting Tranq Bombs.
  • Players can craft Paralysis ammo using Parashrooms and Normal Ammo.

Sleep Herbs aren't the only ingredient in a Tranq Bomb; every hunter will also need just as many Parashrooms. Luckily, the trading system also allows players to acquire such fungi from Sild's very own Rysher.

He provides a steady stream of Parashrooms to the player, although they won't be as frequent as Apar's Sleep Herbs since they're rated at 2 stars instead of 3. Much like when players are trading with Apar, it remains a convenient way to passively earn materials in between hunts.

Plundering Parashrooms In Oilwell Basin

A Brief But Necessary Diversion

  • The Oilwell Basin only provides one Parashroom gathering point.
  • While in the Oilwell Basin, be sure to mine for Fucium Ore for other crafting purposes.

While the Oilwell Basin contains the fewest number of gathering points for Tranq Bombs, it's nonetheless relevant to mention where hunters can acquire Parashrooms while mounting a Gravios or tracking down a Tempered Ajarakan. In area 12, hunters can find a single gathering point for Parashrooms.

The most efficient way to get there would be fast-traveling to the Pop-Up Camp in Area 13: Limestone Cavern. Simply exit through the tunnel into area 13, turn right, and head due north. The gathering point will be hugging the wall on the right side of the room.

Foraging For Parashrooms In The Ruins of Wyveria

A Dangerous Destination

  • While in the Ruins, hunters can gather Wyveria Lanterns for trading purposes.
  • Periodically, Zoh Shia will appear as a quest. Be sure to add it as an investigation!

While players are farming Fulgur Anjanath or waiting for the Zoh Shia to appear, they have access to four different spots to gather Parashrooms. Having a pop-up camp set up in Area 6's Remnant Grove can be risky, as it's a common target for wandering monsters.

Fortunately, it's worth the risk, as two of the four Parashroom spawn points are nearby! One is immediately to the west of the pop-up camp, while the other is due south. Head to the next level down to find the last two in Area 10.

Sleep Herbs Can Be Found In The Iceshard Cliffs

The Most Sleep Herbs In Any Biome

  • The Iceshard Cliffs are the only map where a hunter can reliably gather Carbalite Ore, which is necessary for certain armor sets.
  • Remember to keep an eye out for Rove while in area 20. He'll give you a present if you save him.

Along with an exciting raid boss, the Iceshard cliffs contain the most Sleep Herb gathering spots out of any map in the game. Starting at the pop-up camp in Area 15: Upper Corridor, head down the spiral staircase and grab the first Sleep Herb. Head straight from the bottom of the stairs to the opposite end of Area 15 and grab the herb hugging the wall.

Following that, head north through area 12, and look for the rise on the left upon entering Area 13. After gathering the two Sleep Herbs, fast-travel to the Area 6 pop-up camp. Exit the camp and head northeast; the last Sleep Herb will be on the opposite wall.

Wandering The Windward Plains

An Oasis Amid Danger

  • The Windward Plains contain multiple fishing spots, many of which are near pop-up camps relevant to the farming route.
  • Don't forget to pluck any windward Aloe while near Area 10.

Whether it's a sun-bleached day or amidst a fierce lightning storm, the Windward Plains are a vibrant biome full of collectibles and kaiju alike. While preparing for the archtempered Rey Dau event quest, players can scour the Windward Plains for both parts of a Tranq Bomb all over the map. Starting from the pop-up camp in Area 13: Oasis, hunters can quickly gather a Parashroom just southeast of the camp, but still near the oasis itself.

Following that, head to area 3 via fast travel, and take the eastward exit that leads to area 1; the remaining Parashroom lies at the junction between both areas. Finally, area 10 holds the lone Sleep Herb on the map. It rests near the path towards the next zone, The Scarlet Forest.

Find Everything In The Scarlet Forest

Mandatory While Hunting Mizutsune

  • While gathering Tranq Bomb Materials, remember to gather treasure and Scarlet Amber.
  • This is the only map where it rains, meaning it's easy to proc the Slicked Blade skill on Mizutsune weapons.

The Scarlet Forest contains everything a hunter will need to craft Tranq Bombs. Starting from Base Camp, head out towards the Area 6 pop-up camp, gathering the first of six Parashrooms. Head northeast through Area 6, and upon entering Area 12, the second Parashroom will be visible. The First Sleep herb lies southwest, and continuing to Area 7 leads the player to three Parashrooms, all located near the Area 8 pop-up camp.

Following that, head north to Area 8's marshes for the last Parashroom. Fast-Travel to Area 18, and follow the canopy pathway to the southeast, making a counter-clockwise loop to the Rathian nest. It's here that the last two sleep herbs can be found! It's the perfect gathering run to pair with some tempered Mizutsune expeditions.

10 Images
10 Images

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Fans Are Roasting a New Card
item.description:
Summary

  • Dragon-type Pokemon like Kommo-o face criticism for impractical Energy requirements and low popularity.
  • Despite potential synergies with other cards, Kommo-o faces skepticism in becoming a meta-shifting Dragon-type due to its setup challenges.

Fans of Pokemon TCG Pocket have blasted the newly added Dragon-type Pokemon, Kommo-o, calling it "useless" for several understandable reasons. Since the game's launch, Dragon cards have drawn criticism for their awkward setup, often requiring multiple types of Energy. This makes them difficult to play consistently, and as a result, Dragon-type decks have remained unpopular among Pokemon TCG Pocket players.

Dragon cards have become something of a running joke in the Pocket community. So far, the only Dragon-type to make a mark on the metagame has been Druddigon, while most others have been pushed aside in PvP. The trend continued with the release of TCG Pocket' s Shining Revelry set, which introduced Wugtrio ex, a non-Dragon Pokemon featuring an attack reminiscent of Dragonite. Fans were quick to draw comparisons, with many calling Wugtrio ex "a much better Dragonite." And with the new Celestial Guardians set, it looks like the Dragon-type's losing streak is far from over.

Mocking the state of Dragon-types, Reddit user Polendri shared a meme on the game's subreddit titled "It's a Dragon-type tradition at this point." The cartoon pokes fun at Kommo-o's stats, attack text, and Energy requirements, suggesting it's yet another impractical addition. For the uninitiated, Kommo-o is a Stage Two Pokemon that needs one Lightning and one Fighting Energy to deal 130 damage. The catch is that after each attack, it takes an extra 30 damage from the opponent in the next turn. In short, players feel the card's risk-reward ratio is absurd: it's difficult to set up, yet all too easy to lose.

Kommo-o Seems to be TCG Pocket's Latest Letdown

After Polendri's Reddit post ridiculing Kommo-o, some fans argued that the card's true potential is being overlooked. Several pointed out its strong synergy with the Lightning-type Oricorio, a rising star from Pokemon TCG Pocket' s Celestial Guardians expansion. Others noted that future Trainer Cards, possibly something like the physical TCG' s Double Dragon Energy, could eventually make Kommo-o a meta-shifting Dragon-type.

Some fans are already comparing Kommo-o to Pokemon TCG Pocket' s Giratina, jokingly warning that an ex variant of Kommo-o could shake up the meta in the same way Giratina ex did. For now, players will have to wait for the metagame to settle to see which cards rise to the top. However, based on current trends in PvP, it seems unlikely that Kommo-o will secure a high rank. The new set's era will most likely be dominated primarily by the Lightning archetype, leaving little room for experimental or creative decks in risky categories like the Dragon archetype.

item.title: 8 Video Games Where the Main Character is Psychologically Broken
item.description:
Summary

  • Video games explore fragile minds with broken characters dealing with psychological trauma.
  • "Call of Cthulhu," "Spec Ops: The Line," and others delve deep into madness and horror.
  • Games like "Amnesia: Rebirth" and "The Last of Us 2" depict characters battling darkness and trauma.

Due to their interactive nature, video games have the ability to immerse players in fantastical stories more than any other art form. Games tell incredible stories that bring players directly into the setting, from action-packed quests, nightmarish journeys, to light-hearted adventures.

As the industry has grown, developers have pushed narrative in games even further, with many titles exploring the psychological state of their characters' minds. From mental illness or deep trauma, to cosmic terrors causing madness, these titles feature characters who are psychologically broken. Through their gameplay, storytelling, and world-building, these games explore the fragility of the human mind and the broken realities people face.

8 Call of Cthulhu

An Investigator is Pushed to Breaking Point

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Call of Cthulhu
4 /10
8.5 /10
Released
October 30, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Cyanide Studio
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
Powered by

HP Lovecraft’s enduring literary legacy can be seen in numerous horror games, often revolving around madness and unknowable cosmic terrors. Call of Cthulhu is one of the best of these, and is an immersive RPG survival horror game that blends a strong narrative with stealth and investigation gameplay.

While not a direct adaptation, Call of Cthulhu expertly brings Lovecraft’s world to life in a memorable horror experience that fans of the genre will love. In the game, players control private investigator Edward Pierce as he looks into the strange circumstances around the Hawkins family. Plagued with strange nightmares and suffering trauma from his past, Pierce self-medicates with alcohol and sleeping pills. Throughout the game, Pierce’s already fragile mind is pushed to its limits as he uncovers the truth lurking behind the small island community.

7 Spec Ops: The Line

A Soldier Struggles with the Horrors of War

Your comment has not been saved

Spec Ops: The Line
7 /10
7.5 /10
Released
June 26, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Yager Development
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

This underrated third-person shooter is the seventh release in the Spec-Ops series. In the game, players control Captain Martin Walker, who leads his squad of Delta Force operatives on a recon mission in Dubai. Unlike most shooters set in a warzone, Spec Ops: The Line confronts the harsh realities of war on its characters.

Throughout the game, Captain Walker’s mind slowly crumbles as he experiences hallucinations and stress as the horrors of war take their toll on him. Highly inspired by the classic novel Heart of Darkness and film adaptation Apocalypse Now (1979), Spec Ops: The Line is a must-play experience for fans of military-centered games. While the game failed commercially on release, it remains a cult favorite for many.

6 Amnesia: Rebirth

Escape the Encroaching Darkness

Your comment has not been saved

Amnesia: Rebirth
9 /10
8.0 /10
Released
October 20, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Frictional Games
Platform(s)
PS4, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

The long-awaited sequel to the survival horror classic, Amnesia: Dark Descent , Amnesia: Rebirth is an atmospheric dark fantasy journey into fear and trauma. In the game, players control Tasi, who, after crash landing in the desert with no memory, must uncover the truth about her missing friends and her sudden pregnancy.

Like the first game, darkness is a major threat in the game, with Tasi experiencing extreme fear and hallucinations if left in the dark too long. As the game progresses, her physical changes mirror her breaking psyche as she witnesses numerous horrors and monsters.

5 The Last of Us 2

Continuing the Tragic Story of Traumatized Survivors

Your comment has not been saved

The Last of Us Part 2
10 /10
12
7.3 /10
Released
June 19, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Naughty Dog
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Like the original, The Last of Us 2 is a powerful story of characters surviving the end of the world after a mutating fungus infects the population, turning people into violent monsters. However, this is only the surface, as the game delves deep into the damaging effects of grief and violence.

The Last of Us 2 deals with the ramifications of the first game, with players controlling Ellie after a tragic event changes her life. In the game, Ellie is consumed with anger and guilt, which sends her on a self-destructive mission of revenge that blinds her to everything else. While The Last of Us 2 would be a more divisive game than the original, its excellent gameplay, emotional storytelling, and realistic and deeply broken characters make it just as compelling as the first.

4 BioShock

One of the Greatest Twists in Gaming

Your comment has not been saved

BioShock
11
9.5 /10
Released
August 21, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Irrational Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

One of the greatest story-driven FPS games ever made, the original BioShock is a masterclass of action, story, and design. The game revolves around the player descending into the underwater city of Rapture, which has become a ruin of its former self. While many of the city's inhabitants have fallen into violent madness, the protagonist, Jack, is presented as a silent, unstoppable hero.

As the story progresses, through a shocking twist, players soon learn the central character’s broken mind is not what it seems. BioShock explores ideas of truth, identity, and reality and is largely considered one of the best video games of all time.

3 Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice

A Warrior's Battle Against Her Curse

Your comment has not been saved

Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice
8 /10
8.4 /10
Released
August 16, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Ninja Theory
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Switch, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

In this dark fantasy adventure game, players control Senua, a disturbed young Pict Warrior, on a mission to rescue her lover from the goddess Hela. Inspired by Norse and Celtic mythology, the central protagonist believes she is cursed and struggles to fight these enemies, seemingly in her head. The game uses these otherworldly forces, known as the Darkness, to represent Senua’s psychosis.

Senua often has dark visions and hears voices speaking to her throughout the game, known as Furies. Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice is a darkly compelling exploration of mental illness and blends puzzle-solving, psychological horror, and action. On release, the game was critically acclaimed and praised for its themes and storytelling.

2 Darkest Dungeon

The Darker Side of Adventuring

Your comment has not been saved

Darkest Dungeon
9 /10
8.6 /10
Released
January 19, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Alcohol Reference, Blood and Gore, Mild Language, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Red Hook Studios
Platform(s)
PS4, PS Vita, Xbox One, Switch, PC, iOS
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

This challenging Roguelike RPG follows the exploits of a constantly changing party of adventurers as they explore various ruins, dungeons, and caves. Using turn-based combat, players encounter various threats and traps that can easily hurt or kill the characters.

However, unlike other RPGs, Darkest Dungeon is about survival over victory and revolves around the trauma that comes with violence and stress. Each character can be afflicted with various psychological problems, which can include becoming Paranoid, Abusive, Masochistic, or irrational. These states bring negative effects to the party and sometimes result in death.

1 Disco Elysium

A Broken Detective Teetering on the Edge

Your comment has not been saved

Disco Elysium
9 /10
12
9.6 /10
Released
October 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION

ESRB

Platform(s)
PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

This unique isometric RPG, with its dark humor, oil-painted art style, and philosophical and political themes, is widely considered one of the best video games ever made. In Disco Elysium , players control an alcoholic detective suffering from amnesia as he investigates a gruesome murder with his partner, Detective Kim Kitsuragi, who often acts as the character's moral compass.

The game features no real combat mechanics, with all actions resolved through dialogue and skill checks. The central character is extremely broken and suffers from numerous psychological problems. The game's narrator is the detective’s subconscious and is presented as a separate character, further revealing the protagonist's broken psyche.

item.title: Genshin Impact Details Varka's First Appearance and Nod-Krai's Factions
item.description:
Genshin Impact has confirmed that Varka will make his first in-game appearance in Nod-Krai and revealed lore details about the region's main factions. Genshin Impact previously stated that Nod-Krai would be the next major area in players' journeys, as it would set the stage for Snezhnaya in the future.

Out of Teyvat's seven nations under an Archon, Snezhnaya is the only one left in the Traveler's quest. After the Natlan Archon Quest ended, players were expecting that Genshin Impact would follow its usual formula and transport them to the Cryo Nation in Version 6.0. However, HoYoverse announced that fans will first visit Nod-Krai, a subregion in southern Snezhnaya that welcomes people from all of Teyvat. The news disappointed some fans, but according to the developers, Genshin Impact 's Nod-Krai chapter is supposed to fill important lore gaps in the game, and multiple characters will be involved.

During its latest "Let's Start With Nod-Krai" livestream, Genshin Impact 's dev team revealed which characters players will meet in Nod-Krai. They confirmed that Varka, the Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius, would be the first person players meet in the region. This will be Varka's first in-game appearance, aiming to give players a sense of security in this unknown place. Genshin Impact confirmed that Varka and his expedition team will be investigating something in Nod-Krai. HoYoverse added that some Varka voicelines will be present in Genshin Impact Version 5.6 as well, as one of his dialogues was featured in the update's trailer.

Genshin Impact Reveals Varka's and Other Factions' Roles in Nod-Krai

Aside from Varka's Knights of Favonius, Nod-Krai harbors various factions, and HoYoverse elaborated on five of them. Among them are the Fatui Harbingers, who are in Nod-Krai trying to "steal the power of the moon." Their goal clashes with the Frostmoon Scions, a group of people who worship the Moon Goddess and are capable of using magic. Next is the Voynich Guild, a merchant guild based in Nasha Town that is also linked to the Curatorium of Secrets organization.

HoYoverse then talked about the Lightkeepers and the Wild Hunt, two factions that are enemies to each other. The Abyssal forces are very powerful in Nod-Krai, and their combined strength is known as the Wild Hunt. Thus, the Lightkeepers are an organization in charge of fighting the Wild Hunt calamities.

According to the developers, the Nod-Krai era will begin as soon as Version 5.8 wraps up and will last for about a year. The livestream gifted players some limited Genshin Impact codes for free Primogems. One of these codes teased that Genshin Impact Version 6.0 and Nod-Krai may arrive on September 10, 2025.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: 8 Most Fun Survival Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Ark: Survival Evolved excels in open-world survival with meaningful progression and fun dinosaur rides.
  • Grounded offers a creative and unique survival experience in a backyard setting with thrilling battles.
  • V Rising delivers a dark vampire survival experience with RPG mechanics and engaging combat.

Survival games have been around since the start of the gaming world, demanding players to go out into an unknown landscape and find whatever resources they can to stay alive. There have been plenty of genre blends throughout the years that fuse survival with other themes and styles like RPGs, horror, and strategy, each bringing their own unique flair to the concept and offering experiences for any and all kinds of players.

Games at their core are built for enjoyment, and it is no good having a well-crafted world full of excitement and wonder if the players just can't have any fun in it. Thankfully, there are plenty of titles that push far more resources into creating an enjoyable experience that still delivers all the core values and expectations of a grueling genre like survival.

8 Ark: Survival Evolved

A Prehistoric World Full Of Dead Dinos

Your comment has not been saved

ARK: Survival Evolved
9.0 /10
Released
August 29, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Crude Humor, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Studio Wildcard
Platform(s)
Linux, macOS, PC, PS4, Xbox One, Stadia, Switch, iOS, Android
OpenCritic Rating
Weak
Powered by

A titan in the genre and a game that literally has survival in its name, Ark is the perfect example of open-world survival done right. Spawning on an expansive island full of life and color, players must venture out either alone or in a group and gather whatever resources they can to defend themselves against the prehistoric beasts that litter the landscape. Every step of the progression from the base-building to the weaponry feels meaningful, and players are really rewarded for focusing on specific build paths and exploring parts of the world that were previously too dangerous.

And it goes without saying that being able to ride on the back of iconic dinosaurs, across beautiful, lush land, is pretty damn fun and the incentive to continue getting stronger of the world bosses, adds a nice goal to keep players motivated in an otherwise directionless world. It can be quite tricky to get into without some good direction, but after the growing pains wear off, the game really is amazing and has so many elements and features that have since become staples in the survival world, and it continues to impress nearly a decade after its release.

7 Grounded

Bite-sized Fun Right In The Backyard

Your comment has not been saved

Grounded
Survival
Systems
Released
September 27, 2022
ESRB
Teen // Blood, Mild Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment

Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Shrinking down players to the size of an ant and throwing them into a perilous backyard world, Grounded is certainly one of the more creative and unique takes on the survival genre, for reasons more than just the setting. As opposed to taking on zombies or gigantic fantasy beasts, players are confronted with swarms of angry insects and arachnids that, from a miniature perspective, are a whole lot bigger and scarier than before. It's a constant battle to manage food and hydration, alongside defending the base against the range of creepy crawlies that scuttle across the grassy plains at great speed.

The setting alone is enough to elicit smiles and enjoyment. A world out of a children's coloring book, everything about the environment just screams imagination and joy, turning a simplistic grassy garden into an exciting land of adventure. There are also plenty of gameplay elements that kick the fun into the next gear, like ziplines that allow for traversal between forts, and intense battles against menacing spiders, that feel like gigantic battles against a monumental foe. Everything put together transforms a basic everyday world into a fantastical one, and gives the game so much charm and entertainment that it's hard to put down, especially when playing with a group of good friends.

6 Raft

An Aquatic Co-op Adventure Unlike Any Other

Your comment has not been saved

Raft
Survival
Systems
Released
June 20, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Redbeet Interactive
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

One of the first scenarios that comes to mind when the word survival is mentioned is a desert island, and there is no better game at emulating the openness and dangers of the sea than Raft . The title says it all. Build a raft, sail across the ocean, and land ashore in the hopes of finding food and other resources to expand the wooden platform into a full-blown oceanic resort. The excitement that comes from spotting a speck of sand in the distance and rushing over to it, looking for treasure, is truly unmatched, and when combined with the constant threat from the sea life below, the tension and fun rise with every moment.

Each wave that passes by marks a new step of progress towards a stable life on the seven seas, and the struggles early on are soon forgotten as the players soon acquire tools and weapons to help them survive in a dangerous and unforgiving world. And the more open style story and objectives make the exploration feel more meaningful, as every time a new area is discovered, it could either mean a step towards Utopia, or some invaluable resources to keep the adventure going.

5 V Rising

Build A Castle Fit For A Vampire King

Your comment has not been saved

V Rising
9.0 /10
Released
May 17, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Stunlock Studios
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Survival has always been a game genre that leans into some spooky elements, but V Rising goes straight into the gothic realm and delivers a dark and gloomy experience that is a pleasure from start to finish. Awakening as a vampire in a world full of hostile humans, players spend their time hunting for prey in the thick forests and murky swamps, all while avoiding the sunlight, adding a constant threat to the already challenging gameplay. But the enjoyment comes from the role reversal, now playing as the predator and stalking unsuspecting victims from the shadows and ambushing them with a long list of attacks and abiities.

The combination of RPG mechanics and classic survival elements like base building makes the game an absolute delight to playthrough. And the fast and responsive combat truly makes the player feel like a vicious vampire out for their next kill. It feeds into the vampire fantasy perfectly, and the game transcends just survival, becoming a game more about ruling a kindgom in a dark fantasy world that is both addictive and genuinely fun.

4 Subnautica

Bringing The Fear Of The Ocean To Life

Your comment has not been saved

Subnautica
13
9.2 /10
Released
January 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Unknown Worlds Entertainment
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Swapping the safety of land for the barrenness of the ocean, Subnautica is an incredibly unique survival game that has since become a cult classic in the survival world. Stranded on an alien planet with just an empty ship and their wits, the player has to dive deep into the watery abyss to hunt for materials and resources in order to make it back to civilization alive. The underwater traversal is incredibly fun and never feels slow or sluggish, and the world below the surface is never empty, being full of both beauty and a few horrors lurking around the corner.

Every step towards leaving the planet feels like a leap of progress, unlocking new tools and functions to allow for more bold adventuring into deeper and darker waters. And even though the game does feature a pretty in-depth base builder, often times the world is too alluring to ignore and players will want to spend far more time swimming around with the fishes than staying in the safety of their home. A great game for any fans of the survival genre who are looking for something different, and even better for those looking to enter the space with a hit they won't forget.

3 Don't Starve Together

A Cute Yet Scary Land That's Better With A Friend

Your comment has not been saved

Don't Starve Together
8.0 /10
Released
December 15, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Fantasy Violence, Crude Humor
Developer(s)
Klei Entertainment
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Xbox One, Switch
Powered by

The original Don't Starve was already fun enough as a solo adventure, but bringing in an expanded player limit with Don't Starve Together, adds a whole new level of enjoyment that the original could never quite capture. A cutesy art style combined with elements of horror, players must scavenge across a wilderness with almost no guidance but their will to explore. It forces a lot of quick thinking and requires consistent resource management, which is made even more enjoyable given the extra mouths to feed and protect.

The world is harsh and at times cruel, with players battling against both the elements and the wildlife that gets particularly rowdy when the sun goes down. What really makes the game stand out is the unpredictability of the world, with every session providing something new to tackle and unravel together. It never holds the player's hand, but that lack of direction almost boosts the desire to adventure out for more resources and battles. It's a charming game that really embraces the weird and wonderful, and few games encapsulate a level of joy quite like this.

2 Palworld

Guns And Adorable Creatures In A World Of Wonder

PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
OpenCritic Rating

Powered by

From the trailers alone, it's clear that Palworld is something special. A Frankenstein's monster that fuses aspects from Pokémon, hardcore survival, and RPGs to deliver one of the most distinctive gaming experiences in recent memory. An open landscape full of cute and curious critters just waiting to be caught, the blending of survival elements and creature catching is really something that needs to be experienced first-hand to truly appreciate, and the limits on what players can do with their new friends are basically gone, whether they want to ride them like a horse, or put them to work in a production line straight out of a dystopian novel.

The game prides itself on not being restrictive in its approach, encouraging players to take on challenges and the world however they choose. Building a base from scratch feels like constructing an entire town that blends fantasy with industry, and when players are ready and geared up enough, the battles that hide deep in the dungeons below are incredibly rewarding and exciting to take on, whether in a group or alone with the Pals. Creativity really is the name of the game, and Palworld never says no in terms of what is possible and how players can play the game, elevating the immersion, humor, and fun to new heights.

1 No Mans Sky

The Pinnacle Of Open-universe Exploration

Your comment has not been saved

No Man's Sky
7 /10

August 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Animated Blood
Developer(s)
Hello Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

What started as a failure has now blossomed into an entire, exhilarating universe. No Man's Sky stands as one of the greatest achievements in the survival genre and perhaps gaming as a whole. The game is quite literally a near-infinite universe brimming with planets and lifeforms just waiting to be discovered, some full of beauty and wonder, and others, dangerous threats. Resource management is key to navigating the uncharted territories that await, as the environment can be the biggest enemy that delivers toxic storms, extreme temperatures, and alien enemies to constantly pressure the player. Every step onto a new planet feels like uncovering a lost world that could either be bountiful in resources or perilous for even seasoned explorers.

The joy comes from the boundless freedom of the universe and the continual evolution of both the player and the worlds around them. Standard survival tropes like base-building turn simple landscapes into sprawling outposts, while the ability to level up the player's mining and fighting capabilities makes sticking around on one planet feel more like a quick pit stop to fuel the next adventure. Every update adds a whole new level of variety and exploration that continues to make the game feel even more alive than before, and after a very rocky start when it released, No Man's Sky has turned into an exceptional survival experience that really knows no contemporary.
